private-limited-company.title: Private Limited Company Registration
private-limited-company.description: Transform your business idea into a legally recognized entity with complete liability protection and professional credibility.

whatIs.title: What is a Private Limited Company?
whatIs.description: A Private Limited Company is a type of business entity where shareholders' liability is limited to their investment, and shares cannot be publicly traded. It's a separate legal entity from its owners, offering personal asset protection and enhanced credibility.

process.title: Name Approval
process.description: Apply for name approval through MCA portal with up to 2 name options.

process.title: DSC & DIN Application
process.description: Obtain Digital Signature Certificate and Director Identification Number.

process.title: Document Filing
process.description: Submit incorporation documents including MOA, AOA, and other forms.

process.title: Registration Approval
process.description: Receive Certificate of Incorporation from MCA.

process.title: Post Registration
process.description: Complete PAN, TAN, GST, and bank account opening formalities.

forDirectors: Bank statement/utility bill for address proof

faqs.question: What is the minimum capital required for Private Limited Company?
faqs.answer: There is no minimum capital requirement as per the Companies Act 2013. You can start with a nominal paid-up capital of ₹1 lakh or even less.

faqs.question: How many directors are required?
faqs.answer: A minimum of 2 and maximum of 15 directors are required. At least one director must be a resident Indian.

faqs.question: Can a salaried person be a director?
faqs.answer: Yes, a salaried person can be a director unless their employment contract specifically prohibits it.

faqs.question: What are the annual compliance requirements?
faqs.answer: Annual compliances include filing annual returns, financial statements, income tax returns, GST returns, and conducting annual general meetings.

opc.title: One Person Company Registration
opc.description: Start your entrepreneurial journey with a One Person Company - a perfect blend of sole proprietorship and private limited company benefits.

whatIs.title: What is a One Person Company?
whatIs.description: A One Person Company (OPC) is a type of business entity that allows a single person to run a company with limited liability protection. It combines the benefits of a sole proprietorship with the advantages of a private limited company.

process.title: Name Approval
process.description: Apply for name approval through MCA portal with up to 2 name options.

process.title: DSC & DIN Application
process.description: Obtain Digital Signature Certificate and Director Identification Number.

process.title: Document Filing
process.description: Submit incorporation documents including MOA, AOA, and other forms.

process.title: Registration Approval
process.description: Receive Certificate of Incorporation from MCA.

process.title: Post Registration
process.description: Complete PAN, TAN, GST, and bank account opening formalities.

forDirector: Bank statement/utility bill for address proof

faqs.question: What is the minimum capital required for OPC?
faqs.answer: There is no minimum capital requirement for OPC registration. You can start with a nominal paid-up capital.

faqs.question: Can an OPC have more than one director?
faqs.answer: An OPC must have only one director, but it can have a nominee director who will take over in case of the main director's death or incapacity.

faqs.question: What are the annual compliance requirements for OPC?
faqs.answer: Annual compliances include filing annual returns, financial statements, income tax returns, GST returns, and conducting board meetings.

faqs.question: Can an OPC be converted to a Private Limited Company?
faqs.answer: Yes, an OPC can be converted to a Private Limited Company when its paid-up capital exceeds ₹50 lakhs or annual turnover exceeds ₹2 crores.

llp.title: Limited Liability Partnership Registration
llp.description: Combine the benefits of partnership flexibility with corporate liability protection for your business.

whatIs.title: What is a Limited Liability Partnership?
whatIs.description: A Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) is a hybrid business structure that combines the operational flexibility of a partnership with the limited liability benefits of a corporation. Partners are not personally liable for the misconduct or negligence of other partners.

process.title: Name Approval
process.description: Apply for LLP name approval through MCA portal.

process.title: DSC & DIN
process.description: Obtain Digital Signature Certificate and Director Identification Number for designated partners.

process.title: LLP Agreement
process.description: Draft and execute LLP agreement defining partnership terms.

process.title: Registration Filing
process.description: Submit incorporation documents to MCA.

process.title: Certificate Issuance
process.description: Receive LLP incorporation certificate and complete post-registration formalities.

faqs.question: What is the minimum number of partners required for LLP?
faqs.answer: A minimum of 2 partners are required to form an LLP. There is no maximum limit on the number of partners.

faqs.question: Is there any minimum capital requirement for LLP?
faqs.answer: No, there is no minimum capital requirement for LLP registration.

faqs.question: What are the annual compliance requirements for LLP?
faqs.answer: LLPs need to file annual returns, maintain books of accounts, and comply with income tax and GST requirements.

gst-registration.title: GST Registration
gst-registration.description: Get your business registered under GST to comply with tax regulations and expand your market reach.

whatIs.title: What is GST Registration?
whatIs.description: GST (Goods and Services Tax) registration is mandatory for businesses with annual turnover exceeding ₹20 lakhs (₹10 lakhs for special category states). It enables businesses to collect GST from customers and claim input tax credits.

process.title: Document Preparation
process.description: Collect and prepare all required documents for GST registration.

process.title: Online Application
process.description: Submit GST registration application on the GST portal.

process.title: Verification
process.description: GST department verifies the application and documents.

process.title: Certificate Issuance
process.description: Receive GST registration certificate with GSTIN.

faqs.question: Is GST registration mandatory for all businesses?
faqs.answer: GST registration is mandatory for businesses with annual turnover exceeding ₹20 lakhs (₹10 lakhs for special category states) or involved in inter-state supply.

faqs.question: Can I get voluntary GST registration?
faqs.answer: Yes, businesses can opt for voluntary GST registration even if their turnover is below the threshold limit.

faqs.question: What is GSTIN?
faqs.answer: GSTIN (Goods and Services Tax Identification Number) is a unique 15-digit number assigned to every GST registered business.

roc-annual-compliances.title: ROC Annual Compliances
roc-annual-compliances.description: Stay compliant with all ROC requirements including annual returns and financial statements.

whatIs.title: What are ROC Annual Compliances?
whatIs.description: ROC (Registrar of Companies) Annual Compliances are mandatory requirements for companies to file their annual returns and financial statements with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather financial statements, board meeting minutes, and other required documents.

process.title: Financial Preparation
process.description: Prepare and review financial statements and annual returns.

process.title: Board Meeting
process.description: Conduct board meeting and prepare minutes.

process.title: Filing
process.description: File annual returns and financial statements with ROC.

faqs.question: What is the due date for filing annual returns?
faqs.answer: Annual returns must be filed within 60 days from the date of Annual General Meeting (AGM).

faqs.question: What happens if I miss the filing deadline?
faqs.answer: Late filing attracts additional fees and penalties. It's important to file within the due date to avoid these charges.

trademark-registration.title: Trademark Registration & Protection
trademark-registration.description: Protect your brand identity with our end-to-end trademark registration services.

whatIs.title: What is Trademark Registration?
whatIs.description: Trademark registration provides legal protection for your brand name, logo, or slogan, preventing others from using similar marks in the same business category.

process.title: Trademark Search
process.description: Conduct comprehensive search to ensure mark availability.

process.title: Application Filing
process.description: Prepare and file trademark application with proper documentation.

process.title: Examination & Publication
process.description: Handle examination process and respond to objections if any.

process.title: Registration
process.description: Obtain registration certificate and provide renewal guidance.

faqs.question: How long does trademark registration take?
faqs.answer: The complete process typically takes 18-24 months, though the application filing is done within a week.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a trademark?
faqs.answer: A trademark is valid for 10 years from the filing date and can be renewed indefinitely for subsequent periods of 10 years.

itr-4-filing.title: ITR-4 Return Filing – Presumptive Taxation
itr-4-filing.description: Specialized tax filing service for businesses under presumptive taxation scheme.

whatIs.title: What is ITR-4 Filing?
whatIs.description: ITR-4 is a tax return form for businesses and professionals opting for presumptive taxation scheme under sections 44AD, 44ADA, and 44AE of the Income Tax Act.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather income and expense details, bank statements, and other required documents.

process.title: Income Computation
process.description: Calculate taxable income under presumptive taxation scheme.

process.title: Return Preparation
process.description: Prepare ITR-4 with accurate computations and documentation.

process.title: Filing
process.description: File return and provide acknowledgment and post-filing support.

faqs.question: Who can file ITR-4?
faqs.answer: ITR-4 can be filed by individuals, HUFs, and firms (other than LLPs) having total income up to ₹50 lakhs and opting for presumptive taxation scheme.

faqs.question: What is the due date for filing ITR-4?
faqs.answer: The due date is typically July 31st of the assessment year, unless extended by the government.

sole-proprietorship.title: Sole Proprietorship Registration
sole-proprietorship.description: Start your business journey with the simplest form of business registration - perfect for individual entrepreneurs and small businesses.

whatIs.title: What is a Sole Proprietorship?
whatIs.description: A Sole Proprietorship is the simplest form of business structure where an individual owns and operates the business. The owner has complete control and receives all profits, but also bears all risks and liabilities.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather required documents including identity proof, address proof, and business details.

process.title: Business Name Registration
process.description: Register your business name and obtain necessary licenses.

process.title: GST Registration
process.description: Apply for GST registration if required based on turnover.

process.title: MSME Registration
process.description: Register under MSME for additional benefits and recognition.

process.title: Bank Account Setup
process.description: Assistance in opening a current account for business transactions.

forProprietor: Bank statement/utility bill for address proof

faqs.question: What is the minimum capital required for Sole Proprietorship?
faqs.answer: There is no minimum capital requirement for starting a Sole Proprietorship. You can start with any amount of capital.

faqs.question: Can a Sole Proprietorship be converted to a Company later?
faqs.answer: Yes, a Sole Proprietorship can be converted to a Private Limited Company or OPC when the business grows and requires a more formal structure.

faqs.question: What are the tax implications for Sole Proprietorship?
faqs.answer: The proprietor's business income is taxed as personal income under the Income Tax Act. GST registration is required if turnover exceeds ₹20 lakhs (₹10 lakhs for special category states).

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to register a Sole Proprietorship?
faqs.answer: While Sole Proprietorship doesn't require mandatory registration, it's advisable to register for GST, MSME, and obtain necessary licenses for legal compliance and business credibility.

gst-filing.title: GST Return Filing Services
gst-filing.description: Ensure timely and accurate GST return filing with our expert services - stay compliant and avoid penalties.

whatIs.title: What is GST Return Filing?
whatIs.description: GST Return Filing is the process of submitting details of sales, purchases, and tax payments to the government. Regular filing is mandatory for all GST-registered businesses to maintain compliance and claim input tax credits.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather sales and purchase invoices, bank statements, and other relevant documents.

process.title: Data Processing
process.description: Process and verify all transaction data for accuracy and completeness.

process.title: Return Preparation
process.description: Prepare GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B with proper reconciliation of input tax credits.

process.title: Filing & Payment
process.description: File returns and assist with GST payment processing.

process.title: Post-filing Support
process.description: Provide filing acknowledgment and handle any post-filing queries.

faqs.question: What are the different types of GST returns?
faqs.answer: Common GST returns include GSTR-1 (outward supplies), GSTR-3B (summary return), GSTR-2 (inward supplies), and annual returns. The specific returns depend on your business type and turnover.

faqs.question: What is the due date for GST filing?
faqs.answer: GSTR-1 is due by the 11th of the next month, GSTR-3B by the 20th, and annual returns by December 31st of the following financial year.

faqs.question: What happens if I miss the filing deadline?
faqs.answer: Late filing attracts interest and late fees. The late fee is ₹50 per day for GSTR-3B and ₹100 per day for GSTR-1, subject to maximum limits.

faqs.question: Can I revise my GST returns?
faqs.answer: GSTR-1 can be revised in the next month's return, but GSTR-3B cannot be revised. Any errors in GSTR-3B must be adjusted in the next return.

income-tax-filing.title: Income Tax Return Filing Services
income-tax-filing.description: Expert income tax return filing services for individuals and businesses - maximize your tax savings and ensure compliance.

whatIs.title: What is Income Tax Return Filing?
whatIs.description: Income Tax Return (ITR) filing is the process of submitting your income details and tax payments to the Income Tax Department. It's mandatory for individuals and businesses meeting certain income thresholds and helps in claiming tax refunds and maintaining financial records.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather income proofs, investment details, bank statements, and other relevant documents.

process.title: Income Computation
process.description: Calculate total income, deductions, and tax liability with expert guidance.

process.title: Return Preparation
process.description: Prepare ITR with accurate computations and proper documentation.

process.title: Filing & Verification
process.description: File return and assist with e-verification process.

process.title: Post-filing Support
process.description: Provide filing acknowledgment and handle any post-filing queries.

faqs.question: What is the due date for filing ITR?
faqs.answer: For individuals and businesses, the due date is typically July 31st of the assessment year. For businesses requiring audit, the due date is September 30th.

faqs.question: What happens if I miss the filing deadline?
faqs.answer: Late filing attracts a penalty of up to ₹10,000 and interest on outstanding tax. You may also lose certain tax benefits and face difficulties in loan processing.

faqs.question: Can I revise my income tax return?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can revise your ITR within one year from the end of the relevant assessment year if you discover any errors or omissions.

faqs.question: What documents are needed for tax filing?
faqs.answer: Essential documents include PAN, Aadhaar, Form 16/16A, bank statements, investment proofs, and property details. Additional documents may be required based on your income sources.

copyright-registration.title: Copyright Registration Services
copyright-registration.description: Protect your creative works with copyright registration - secure your intellectual property rights and prevent unauthorized use.

whatIs.title: What is Copyright Registration?
whatIs.description: Copyright registration provides legal protection for original creative works such as literary works, music, art, software, and other intellectual creations. It gives the creator exclusive rights to use, reproduce, and distribute their work.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather the original work, author details, and other required documents.

process.title: Application Preparation
process.description: Prepare copyright application with proper documentation and work samples.

process.title: Filing & Examination
process.description: File application with Copyright Office and handle examination process.

process.title: Registration
process.description: Obtain copyright registration certificate upon approval.

process.title: Post-registration Support
process.description: Provide guidance on copyright protection and enforcement.

faqs.question: What types of works can be copyrighted?
faqs.answer: Copyright protection is available for literary works, musical compositions, artistic works, cinematographic films, sound recordings, computer programs, and other original creative works.

faqs.question: How long does copyright protection last?
faqs.answer: Copyright protection typically lasts for the lifetime of the author plus 60 years. For anonymous works, it's 60 years from the date of publication.

faqs.question: Is copyright registration mandatory?
faqs.answer: While copyright exists automatically upon creation, registration provides legal evidence of ownership and is recommended for better protection and enforcement of rights.

faqs.question: Can I register multiple works together?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can register multiple works in a single application if they are part of the same series or collection, subject to certain conditions.

patent-registration.title: Patent Registration Services
patent-registration.description: Secure exclusive rights to your invention with our comprehensive patent registration services - protect your innovation and maximize its commercial potential.

whatIs.title: What is Patent Registration?
whatIs.description: Patent registration grants exclusive rights to inventors for their inventions, preventing others from making, using, or selling the patented invention without permission. It provides legal protection for new and innovative products, processes, or technologies.

process.title: Patentability Search
process.description: Conduct comprehensive search to check novelty and patentability of the invention.

process.title: Application Drafting
process.description: Prepare detailed patent specification, claims, and drawings.

process.title: Filing & Publication
process.description: File patent application and handle publication process.

process.title: Examination
process.description: Respond to examination reports and objections.

process.title: Grant & Maintenance
process.description: Obtain patent grant and provide maintenance support.

faqs.question: What can be patented?
faqs.answer: New inventions that are novel, non-obvious, and have industrial applicability can be patented. This includes products, processes, machines, compositions, and improvements to existing inventions.

faqs.question: How long does patent protection last?
faqs.answer: Patent protection lasts for 20 years from the filing date, subject to payment of annual maintenance fees.

faqs.question: Can I file a patent application myself?
faqs.answer: While it's possible to file yourself, it's highly recommended to use a patent attorney or agent due to the complex legal and technical requirements of patent applications.

faqs.question: What is the cost of maintaining a patent?
faqs.answer: Patent maintenance requires annual fee payments to the patent office. The fees increase over time, and non-payment can lead to patent abandonment.

fssai-license.title: FSSAI License Registration
fssai-license.description: Get your FSSAI license to legally operate your food business - ensure compliance with food safety standards and build customer trust.

whatIs.title: What is FSSAI License?
whatIs.description: FSSAI (Food Safety and Standards Authority of India) License is mandatory for all food businesses in India. It ensures that food businesses comply with food safety standards and regulations set by the government.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather required documents including business proof, identity proof, and food safety plan.

process.title: Application Preparation
process.description: Prepare FSSAI application with proper documentation and food safety plan.

process.title: Inspection Support
process.description: Assist with food safety inspection and compliance requirements.

process.title: License Issuance
process.description: Obtain FSSAI license upon successful inspection.

process.title: Post-registration Support
process.description: Provide guidance on compliance maintenance and renewal process.

faqs.question: What are the types of FSSAI licenses?
faqs.answer: FSSAI offers three types of licenses: Basic Registration (turnover up to ₹12 lakhs), State License (turnover ₹12 lakhs to ₹20 crores), and Central License (turnover above ₹20 crores).

faqs.question: How long is the FSSAI license valid?
faqs.answer: FSSAI license is valid for 1 to 5 years, depending on the type of license and payment made. It can be renewed before expiry.

faqs.question: What are the penalties for operating without FSSAI license?
faqs.answer: Operating without a valid FSSAI license can attract penalties up to ₹5 lakhs and imprisonment up to 6 months.

faqs.question: Can I apply for FSSAI license online?
faqs.answer: Yes, FSSAI license application can be made online through the FoSCoS portal. However, physical inspection is mandatory before license issuance.

msme-registration.title: MSME Registration Services
msme-registration.description: Register your business under MSME to avail government benefits, subsidies, and priority sector lending - boost your business growth with official recognition.

whatIs.title: What is MSME Registration?
whatIs.description: MSME (Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises) Registration is a government recognition for small businesses that provides access to various benefits, subsidies, and support schemes. It helps businesses establish their credibility and access financial assistance.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather required documents including business proof, identity proof, and financial statements.

process.title: Application Preparation
process.description: Prepare MSME application with proper documentation and business details.

process.title: Online Filing
process.description: Submit application through Udyam registration portal.

process.title: Certificate Issuance
process.description: Obtain Udyam registration certificate upon approval.

process.title: Post-registration Support
process.description: Provide guidance on availing MSME benefits and schemes.

faqs.question: What are the investment limits for MSME registration?
faqs.answer: For manufacturing: Micro (up to ₹1 crore), Small (up to ₹10 crores), Medium (up to ₹50 crores). For services: Micro (up to ₹10 lakhs), Small (up to ₹2 crores), Medium (up to ₹5 crores).

faqs.question: Is MSME registration mandatory?
faqs.answer: While not mandatory, MSME registration is highly recommended as it provides access to various government benefits, subsidies, and priority sector lending.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of MSME registration?
faqs.answer: Benefits include priority sector lending, tax benefits, subsidy access, tender eligibility, collateral-free loans, and various government schemes.

faqs.question: How long is the MSME registration valid?
faqs.answer: MSME registration is valid for a lifetime and doesn't require renewal. However, you need to update your information if there are any changes in your business.

iso-certification.title: ISO Certification Services
iso-certification.description: Enhance your business credibility and operational efficiency with ISO certification - demonstrate your commitment to quality and international standards.

whatIs.title: What is ISO Certification?
whatIs.description: ISO (International Organization for Standardization) Certification is a globally recognized standard that demonstrates a company's commitment to quality management, environmental responsibility, and operational efficiency. It helps businesses improve processes and gain competitive advantage.

process.title: Gap Analysis
process.description: Assess current processes and identify areas for improvement to meet ISO standards.

process.title: Documentation
process.description: Prepare quality manual, procedures, and work instructions as per ISO requirements.

process.title: Implementation
process.description: Implement quality management system and train employees on new processes.

process.title: Internal Audit
process.description: Conduct internal audit to ensure compliance with ISO standards.

process.title: Certification Audit
process.description: Support during external audit and certification process.

faqs.question: What are the different types of ISO certifications?
faqs.answer: Common ISO certifications include ISO 9001 (Quality Management), ISO 14001 (Environmental Management), ISO 27001 (Information Security), ISO 45001 (Occupational Health and Safety), and ISO 22000 (Food Safety).

faqs.question: How long is ISO certification valid?
faqs.answer: ISO certification is valid for 3 years, subject to successful surveillance audits every 6-12 months. After 3 years, a recertification audit is required.

faqs.question: What is the cost of ISO certification?
faqs.answer: The cost depends on the company size, number of employees, and complexity of processes. It includes documentation, implementation, audit, and certification fees.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get ISO certified?
faqs.answer: The process typically takes 45-60 days, depending on the company's readiness and complexity of operations. This includes documentation, implementation, and audit phases.

roc-compliance.title: ROC Compliance Services
roc-compliance.description: Stay compliant with all ROC requirements including annual returns, financial statements, and board meetings - avoid penalties and maintain good standing.

whatIs.title: What is ROC Compliance?
whatIs.description: ROC (Registrar of Companies) Compliance refers to the mandatory requirements that companies must fulfill with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs. This includes filing annual returns, financial statements, and maintaining proper corporate governance.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather financial statements, board meeting minutes, and other required documents.

process.title: Financial Preparation
process.description: Prepare and review financial statements and annual returns.

process.title: Board Meeting
process.description: Conduct board meeting and prepare minutes.

process.title: Filing
process.description: File annual returns and financial statements with ROC.

process.title: Post-filing Support
process.description: Provide filing acknowledgment and handle any post-filing queries.

faqs.question: What is the due date for filing annual returns?
faqs.answer: Annual returns must be filed within 60 days from the date of Annual General Meeting (AGM).

faqs.question: What happens if I miss the filing deadline?
faqs.answer: Late filing attracts additional fees and penalties. It's important to file within the due date to avoid these charges.

faqs.question: What are the key ROC compliance requirements?
faqs.answer: Key requirements include filing annual returns, financial statements, board meeting minutes, director's report, and maintaining statutory registers.

faqs.question: Do I need to conduct board meetings?
faqs.answer: Yes, companies must conduct at least 4 board meetings in a year, with a maximum gap of 120 days between two meetings.
